trans-unit.source: Represents the raw preview part of print previewing from a Windows Forms application, without any dialog boxes or buttons.
Most PrintPreviewControl objects are found on <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewDialog"></xref> objects, but they do not have to be.
When you create an instance of the PrintPreviewControl class, some of the read/write properties are set to initial values.
For a list of these values, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about printing with Windows Forms, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview.
If you wish to print from a Windows Presentation Foundation application, see the <xref:System.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl"></xref> class.
When you create an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> class, the following read/write properties are initialized.

|Property|Default Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.AutoZoom%2A>|`true`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Document%2A>|`null`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Columns%2A>|1| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Rows%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.StartPage%2A>|0| You can change the value for any of these properties through a separate call to the property.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether resizing the control or changing the number of pages shown automatically adjusts the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Zoom*> property.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the changing the control size or number of pages adjusts the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Zoom*> property; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the number of pages displayed horizontally across the screen.
The number of pages displayed horizontally across the screen.
The default is 1.
The set value is less than 1.
Gets the required creation parameters when the control handle is created.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.
Gets or sets a value indicating the document to preview.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument"></xref> representing the document to preview.
Refreshes the preview of the document.
Call this method if the document appearance has changed.
Overrides the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPaint%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Resize"></xref> event.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.AutoZoom%2A> property is set to `true`, the OnResize method resizes the page in proportion to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> control.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.AutoZoom%2A> is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> centers the page on the control.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.StartPageChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnStartPageChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Resets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor*> property to <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors.AppWorkspace*>, which is the default color.

You typically use this method if you are either creating a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> or creating your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl>.
Resets the foreground color of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl"></xref> to <xref:System.Drawing.Color.White*>, which is the default color.

You typically use this method if you are either creating a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> or creating your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether control's elements are aligned to support locales using right-to-left fonts.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RightToLeft"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RightToLeft"></xref>.
Gets or sets the number of pages displayed vertically down the screen.
The number of pages displayed vertically down the screen.
The default is 0.
The set value is less than 1.
Gets or sets the page number of the upper left page.
The page number of the upper left page.
The default is 0.
The set value is less than 0.
Occurs when the start page changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets the text associated with this control.
The text associated with this control.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Text*> property changes.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether printing uses the anti-aliasing features of the operating system.
Anti-aliasing removes jagged lines when fonts are rendered.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if anti-aliasing is used; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Overrides the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The Windows <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
Gets or sets a value indicating how large the pages will appear.
A value indicating how large the pages will appear.
A value of 1.0 indicates full size.
The value is less than or equal to 0.
